CharacteristicsType.description: The elements of this section apply to a variable.

StandardName.description: The CF-compliant 'Standard Name' for the variable.

Reference.description: Provides a link to variable's reference documentation.

Coordinates.description: A variableâ€™s coordinates. These are used to describe how the variable is represented with respect to the Earth geoid.

GridMapping.description: The name of the mapping projection standard for the variable. For example: Mercator. This is sourced from the granule header. See the global attributes section.

Size.description: The computed byte size for the variable, per the data field. Typically, this is the X dimension times the Y dimension times the number of bytes in the data type (8, 16, 32, etc.). For example, 1200 x 1200 x 16 = 23,040,000.

SizeUnits.description: The computed byte size units for the variable, per the data field. For example B, KB, MB, GB.

Bounds.description: Describes the spatial bounds of a variable. Western Longitude, Northern Latitude and Eastern Longitude, Southern Latitude - often specified in decimal degrees. For example, 'UpperLeftPointMtrs = -180.0, 89.5; LowerRightMtrs = 177.5, -89.5.'

ChunkSize.description: Describes the chunk size of a variable. For example, '100'.

Structure.description: This is a string containing the structure of the variable. This is sourced from the granule header. See the variables section.

MeasurementConditions.description: The measurement conditions of the variable.

ReportingConditions.description: The reporting conditions of the variable.

MeasurementsType.description: The elements of this section apply to a measurement.

MeasurementName.description: This element allows authors to provide community sourced words or phrases to further describe the variable data.

MeasurementSource.description: This element allows authors to identify the source of the measurements.

ServiceType.description: The elements of this section apply to a variable.
This element enables specification of service type. The variable may not yet be available via a service. If so, which protocol standard? For example, 'WMS', 'WCS' etc.

Visualizable.description: A flag to indicate whether this variable is able to be visualized within the context of a service.

Subsettable.description: A flag to indicate whether this variable is able to be subsetted within the context of a service.

FillValueType.description: The fill value, fill value type and fill value description  of the variable in the data file. The fill value is generally a value which falls outside the valid range. For example, if the valid range is '0, 360', the fill value may be '-1'.
The elements of this section apply to the fill value of a variable.

Value.description: The fill value of the variable in the data file.

Type.description: Type of the fill value of the variable in the data file.

Description.description: Description of the fill value of the variable in the data file.

SetType.description: The elements of this section apply to a variable.

Name.description: This element enables specification of set name. The variable may grouped within a set. The set is defined by the name, type, size and index. For example, some variables exist in pairs or sets of three or more.

Type.description: This element enables specification of set type. The variable may grouped within a set. The set is defined by the name, type, size and index. For example, some variables exist in pairs or sets of three or more.

Size.description: This element specifies the size of the set.

Index.description: This element specifies the index value within the set for this variable, i.e. 1,2,3.

ValidRangeType.description: Valid range data value of a variable: minimum and maximum values. For example. '-100, 5000'.

Min.description: Minimum data value of a variable.

Max.description: Maximum data value of a variable.

DataTypeEnum.description: This element is used to identify the data type of the variable.

DimensionsType.description: The elements of this section apply to a variable.

Name.description: The names of the dimensions of the variable represented in the data field. For example, 'XDim, YDim'.

Size.description: The values of the dimensions of the variable represented in the data field. For example, '1200, 1200'.

VariableTypeEnum.description: This element is used to identify the variable as a Science Variable or as a Quality Variable or as an Ancillary Variable. If a variable does not contain this field, it will be assumed to be a science variable.

ServiceTypeEnum.description: This element enables specification of service type.

LongName.description: The descriptive name for the variable.

Units.description: The units associated with a variable.

DataType.description: Specify data type of a variable. These types can be either: uint8, uint16, etc.

ValidRange.description: Valid range data value of a variable: minimum and maximum values. For example. '7500, -1', or '0, 377'.

Scale.description: Scale factor which has been applied to the cell value. For example, '0.002'

Offset.description: The physical value corresponding to a cell value of zero. For example, '0.49'.

FillValue.description: The fill value of the variable in the data file. It is generally a value which falls outside the valid range. For example, if the valid range is '0, 360', the fill value may be '-1'.

VariableType.description: Specify basic type of a variable. These types can be either: Science, Ancillary, Quality etc.

Characteristics.description: The characteristics of a variable.  The elements of this section apply to a Variable.

Measurements.description: The measurement information of a variable.

ScienceKeywords.description: Controlled Science Keywords describing the measurements/variables.  The controlled vocabulary for Science Keywords is maintained in the Keyword Management System (KMS).

Service.description: The service information of a variable.

Set.description: The set information of a variable.
